New Records: Argentina beat Chile 3-0 with Mac Allister (48') Alvarez (84') and Dybala (90+1') scoring
Key Match Events: Mac Allister scored in the 48th minute
De Paul and Lo Celso were booked
Nunez, Davila, and Diaz were booked for Chile
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina are top of the South American standings and two points clear of second-placed Uruguay
Chile are down in eighth place, two points behind the qualification spots
Argentina have won five of their opening six qualifiers
Chile have not made an ideal start to CONMEBOL qualifying
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina will be regarded as firm favourites to come out on top against Chile
Argentina possess a squad filled with talent and they should have few problems securing a routine victory on home soil
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina are ranked first in the world by FIFA
Chile are ranked 43rd in the current standings
Argentina will be without Lionel Messi due to an ankle injury
Argentina's Alexis Mac Allister was 'in pain' after pulling up with an unspecified issue in training and is unlikely to feature against Chile
